Login page constructor
Login page
is the first page that users encounter when logging in to the System. This page is required to enter data, which is then checked by the System to identify the registered user and provide the access to the platform.
The GreenData platform provides tools to create a custom Login page according to the needs of the user or business idea of the project.
The login page constructor is available to the user with
permissions
to the corresponding menu item.
Example of a custom Login page:
Settings
The settings are accessed by sequentially selecting the following items in the
user profile menu
: Application Management → Login Page Constructor.
After clicking the
Login page constructor
menu item, the workspace for editing the current authorization page opens in the profile menu.
Most of the workspace is occupied by the Login page view with a panel containing several tabs on the right side of the page. The tab contains configuration options or groups of configuration options.
The registration page can also be customized. The option is available in the corresponding tab after enabling the
"Registration"
setting.
The settings are placed on the right side of the panel:
position on the page
;
background and borders
;
components
;
authorization
;
registration
;
password change
;
password recovery
;
custom template
.
The configuration of elements in "Position on the page", "Background and borders" and "Components" tabs are the same for Login and Authorization pages.
Saving edits made when configuring the login page constructor is done by clicking
located in the lower right corner of the panel.
Let’s take a look at specifics of each setting of the authorization and registration pages.
Position on the page
This tab includes settings that allow the user to select the location and size of the Login window.
Two settings are responsible for the position of the Login window on the page:
horizontally (left, center, right);
vertically (top, center, bottom).
The size of the Login window can be configured using the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Window width, px.
A field that takes values from
440
(default value) to
1000
pixels.
Full screen width
A switch that (after activation) stretches the Login window to the width of the screen.
Window height, px.
A field that takes values up to
600
pixels. The minimum value depends on the filling of the window.
Full screen height
A switch that (after activation) stretches the Login window to the height of the screen.
Background and borders
At this stage, the user can customize the background of the page and the background of the Login window.
Page background
The user can upload an image to set it as the background of the Login page. If the image wasn’t uploaded before, then the "Upload" button would be displayed in the constructor.
If the image was previously uploaded, the selected file would be displayed in the constructor. "Delete" and "Edit" buttons appear after pointing your mouse cursor at the file name.
Login window background
After clicking "Background color and Opacity", a color picker appears, where you can either select a color or enter its name in HEX and RGBA formats. The opacity is adjusted using a slider.
The "no color" option returns the default color of the Login window.
[NOTE]
In the
SaaS environment
, when using the
Community Edition
license, changing the logo is not available.
Components
This section contains configuration options of various elements that populate the Login window.
Subtitle
This group of settings allows the user to customize the text and the location of the title in the Login window.
The necessary configuration is carried out through the following panel elements:
Setting
Purpose
Text title
Entering the title name.
Clicking on
in the "Text title" line opens a modal window for localization settings.
Font
Selecting a font from the drop-down list.
Clear Sans is the default font.
Size
Enter a value to specify the text size. It can take values from
16
to
32
pixels.
Color text
After clicking "Color text", a color picker appears, where you can either select a color or enter its name in HEX and RGBA formats.
Aligning
Determining the Title position (left, middle, right).
Font typeface
Selecting the font appearance. Typefaces used:
Logo
A group of setting options in the "Logo" tab allows the user to upload an image for the logo and select its position on the Login window.
In the
SaaS environment
, when using the
Community Edition
license, changing the logo is not available.
The logo display is configured using the following panel elements
Setting
Purpose
Image
If there’s no previously uploaded image, you can add it by clicking "Upload". The image replaces the button after being uploaded. "Delete" and "Edit" buttons appear after pointing your mouse cursor at the image.
To scale, %
The "To scale, %" field allows you to change the scale of the image (the percentage is calculated from the original image size in pixels) and can take values from
5
to
300
.
At the same time, a block of
132
by
70
pixels is provided for the logo, so the edges of the larger image are cut off.
Image stretching
Image stretching allows you to set the maximum size of the file by one or two parameters, ignoring its original size.
This option is controlled by two checkboxes:
Stretch to the width;
Stretch to height.
"To scale, %" parameter is blocked when
at least one
of the checkboxes is checked.
Aligning
The uploaded image can be aligned by:
Left;
Center;
Right.
Default alignment is set to the left edge.
Input fields
The user can select the style input fields. There are 3 field styles:
This group of setting options is similar to the group of the "Title" element, which parameters are described above.
Position
This options allows you to select the location of the contents of the page relative to the Login window:
Set to the upper border;
Place in the center;
Set to the lower border.
By default, the contents of the page are placed in the center.
The position changes for all the contents of the page, the distance between the elements remains fixed and cannot be changed.
Titles and buttons
The sections
"Authorization"
,
"Registration"
,
"Password Change"
and
"Password Recovery"
, which will be discussed later, contain the subsections "Header" and "Button".
The style of headers and buttons is the same for all custom pages, it means that all the parameters of the "Title" and "Button" subsections, except for the text of the titles and button names, are interconnected.
For example, when changing the color of the authorization button, the setting will be automatically applied to the buttons on the registration, password change and recovery pages.
Title
The "Title" subsection contain the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Text title
Depending on the custom page, the name and value of the parameter will be different, for more information, see the custom page settings section.
Clicking on
in the "Text title" line opens a modal window for localization settings.
Font
Selecting a font from the drop-down list.
Clear Sans is the default font.
Size
Enter a value to specify the text size. It can take values from
16
to
32
pixels.
Color text
After clicking "Color text", a color picker appears, where you can either select a color or enter its name in HEX and RGBA formats.
Aligning
Determining the Title position (left, middle, right).
Font typeface
Selecting the font appearance. Typefaces used:
Button
This set of options is intended for customization of the "Login" button which is used for accessing the System.
The necessary configuration is carried out through the following panel elements:
Setting
Purpose
"Login" button text
Depending on the custom page, the name and value of the parameter will be different, for more information, see the custom page settings section.
Text for the button used by users "Login" button text
Clicking on
in the "Login" button text" field opens a modal window for localization.
Font
Selecting a font from the drop-down list.
Clear Sans is the default font.
Size
Entering a value to specify the size of the button text (depending on the size of the text, the size of the button also changes). The "Size" field can take values from
12
to
24
pixels.
Color button
After clicking "Color button", a color picker appears, where you can either select a color or enter its name in HEX and RGBA formats.
Color text
After clicking "Color text", a color picker appears, where you can either select a color or enter its name in HEX and RGBA formats.
Rounding of corners (px)
The field where you need to specify the shape of the corners of the button. The field can take values from
0
to
100
pixels.
Aligning
Specifying the position of the button in the authorization window (left, right).
Font typeface
Selecting the font appearance. Typefaces used:
+
Authorization
In the "Authorization" tab, the user configures the System authorization method.
The tab consists of three subsections:
Authorization method
The settings in this subsection determine the authorization in the application methods.
The tab contains a setting option “Username first, then password”, which affects the location of the login and password input fields:
if disabled, the fields are located in the same window;
if enabled, the fields are located in different windows, the transition between them is carried out using the “Next” and “Back” buttons.
By default, the switch “Username first, then password” is enabled.
Displaying the login to the application by domain login using the "Use domain login" switch:
when the switch is active, a field for the "Use domain login" is displayed in the authorization window;
when the switch is inactive, this authorization option is not available.
To enable the option requires settings in the application configuration file, more details in
article
.
The ability to log in to the application without pre-registration is controlled by the “Anonymous login” switch:
if the switch is active, the “Continue without account” element will be displayed in the authorization window, by clicking on it it is possible to log in to the application as
anonymous user
;
when the switch is inactive, anonymous login is not possible.
This setting synchronizes with
“Anonymous login” system setting
.
Title
In addition to the
previously
shown set of parameters, this subsection contains the parameter "Authorization header text". This parameter is used to set the name of the header on the authorization page.
Button
In this section, the display of the “Login” button used by the user to log in.
In addition to the set of parameters discussed
earlier
, this subsection contains the parameter "Login button text". The setting configures the name of the "Login" button.
Registration
This section is intended to provide the user with the opportunity to go through the registration process in the application independently.
If the "Registration is available" switch is active, the footer field containing a link to go to the registration window will be displayed in the authorization page view.
A footer is an area located at the bottom of the page.
When this setting is enabled, a representation of the registration page will be displayed in the working area of the screen (an automatic transition to the "Registration Page" tab will occur). At the same time, the following group of settings will be displayed in the "Registration" section in the sidebar:
When activating "The registration is available" option, a warning will appear asking to get familiar and give consent for the processing of personal data.
for SaaS-application:
for On-Premise solution:
The processing of personal data is configured in the section with the same name, for more details follow the
link
.
The registration section provides the following settings:
Registration method
Selecting a registration method determines the way to confirm account data.
By activating the checkbox, you can specify one of the registration methods: SMS/E-mail, or provide the user with both methods for independent selection.
You must select at least one registration method.
SMS setting
The "SMS setting" subsection is available when the
registration method
by SMS is active.
In this case, the setting is done according to the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Mask for entering phone number
When active, a mask is applied to enter the phone number.
By default the switch is in the active position.
SMS verification method
Selecting a verification method by SMS. Available options:
ETL run - generating a verification code and sending a message via a configured SMS service.
ETL object to run
Selecting an ETL process integrated with an SMS sending service.
An ETL process is selected from instances of the "ETL Object" type, for which the "ETL. Sending SMS" type is selected as the value of the "Start object type" attribute.
The selected ETL receives a phone number as input data (string parameter) taking into account the mask and a text message with a verification code, after which it transmits the data to the integrated service to send an SMS message.
The parameter is displayed when the SMS verification method is defined as "ETL run".
Number of attempts
Limiting the number of repeated requests from user. If set to 0, repeated checks will be prohibited.
The default value is 1.
Time to retry, sec
The waiting time before re-sending the verification code by SMS, indicated in seconds. The minimum possible value is 10.
The parameter is not available if the value for the "Number of attempts" is set to 0.
The default value is 60.
Example of setting up an ETL process for registration by phone number
To set up an ETL, perform a number of steps as shown below.
1. Creating an ETL object
Create an instance in the registry of the "ETL object" type, specify its name and identifier.
Select "ETL. Sending SMS" as the value of the "Start object type" attribute
.
"ETL. Sending SMS" is an object type in the registry of which an instance is automatically created during user self-registration. The telephone number specified by user is stored in the “Phone” attribute, and the value of the “Text” attribute is set to a text message with a confirmation code generated by System.
The phone number as a string parameter (with a mask and a text message containing a verification code) will be the input data for the custom ETL process.
2. Setting up an ETL schema
Once the object is created, you need to proceed to
Setting up an ETL schema
by clicking on the button of the same name in the profile control panel.
Add two stages and a final activity to the ETL schema:
“External service” source type – for sending a registration SMS message via an SMS service;
Transformer – to record the status of sending an SMS message.
In the ETL process schema for registration by phone number, it is enough to place only the stage for setting up integration with an SMS service. But to track the sending status, it is recommended to add and configure the stage for tracking the sending status.
2.1. Setting up integration with an SMS service
First of all, select a suitable SMS service, where you should register and receive an api_id (token).
After reading the service documentation, copy an example request to configure the URL and an example response to form a dynamic structure.
Next, configure the "External service" source type:

2.2. Tracking the sending status
To save the SMS sending status, go to the transformer settings.
On the "Additional" tab, add a data transformer of "ETL. Data transformer. Changing an object instance" type and specify the following parameters:
Using this transformer, the message sending status received from the external service will be stored in the “Answer from external service” attribute of the “ETL. Sending SMS” type instance.
E-mail settings
The “E-mail settings” subsection is available in the settings group when
registration method
by E-mail is active and provides an opportunity to configure the e-mail address that will be used to send messages when a user registers in the application.
The subsection provides the list of previously configured
e-mail accounts
with the possibility to select e-mail for mailing.
To edit an existing account click on
, to create a new one click on
, then the following parameters are configured:
Setting
Purpose
Mail service
Specifying of mail service. Possible values:
Yandex;
Mail.ru;
Gmail.
Instruction
Continue to the instructions for setting up the mail service.
When you select a mail service, a link to the corresponding instruction will be displayed.
Email address
The email address from which messages are sent.
Application password
The password to grant access to external applications.
This password must be previously created in the settings of the selected mail service in the “Security” section.
Switching to advanced settings
email account
.
When adding a new account, an instance of the “E-mail account” [SYS_MAIL_ACCOUNT] type will be created, where the “Host”, “Port” and “Protocol” fields in the “Send” block will be filled in automatically according to the specified provider.
In this case, the value of the “Password” parameter is added to the System via
secret variable
.
Button is available after saving the account settings.
Profile settings
In the "Profile Settings" section, the parameters for configuring user registration will be displayed, including:
granting the right to choose a profile;
list of available profiles for registration;
ability to create a new profile.
Switching the "User can select profile" switch to the active position allows the user to select a profile from the presented list.
Toggling the "The user can select a profile" switch to the active position will allow the user to select a profile from the drop-down list.
If the switch is in inactive position, default settings will be used during user registration.
The "Default" settings of the profile are as follows:
The creation of a new profile is carried out by
, after clicking on it, the following settings will appear:
Setting
Purpose
Profile name
Entering the name of the user profile.
Directory for employee
Selecting an instance of the "
Employee directory
" object type [SYS_EMPLOYEE] or the type inherited from it.
Employee unit
Selecting an instance of the "Subdivision" object type [SYS_ORG_STR] or the type inherited from it.
Access Groups
Selecting an instance of the "
"Access group"
object type [SYS_SEC_GROUP].
Multiple values can be selected.
Fill in all of them.
Click "Ok" to save the configured profile. If you made changes to the presented settings but clicked "Cancel", the System will notify you:
To return to unsaved settings, click on the “Cancel” button; to exit the profile editing mode without saving, click on the “Yes, do not save” button.
To view or change the settings of an existing profile, double-click on the profile name.
To replace the default profile, check the box next to the selected profile.
After saving the settings, the user will be able to register in the application by clicking on the link in the footer field on the authorization page.
Personal data processing
In this subsection it is possible to add a document with personal data processing during registration.
The following parameters are used when setting up:
Setting
Purpose
Agreement file
List of files with conditions for personal data processing.
The file is replaced by clicking on the edit icon, after which a modal window will open for selecting the required document on the business analyst’s personal device.
By default agreement templates are attached.
Main text
Text displayed on the registration page if registration is confirmed by SMS.
The default value is "I agree to the Terms and Conditions"
.
Link text
Text of the link that, when clicked, will download the agreement file.
The default value is “of processing my personal data”
.
Link color
Color of the link that, when clicked, will download the agreement file.
The description of other settings is similar to those given
earlier
.
Title
In addition to the set of parameters considered by
previously
, this subsection of the "Registration" section contains the "Registration header text" parameter. This parameter is used to set the header name on the registration page.
Button
In this section, the display of the “Registration” button is configured, which is used by the user during self-registration.
In addition to the set of parameters discussed
previously
, this subsection contains the “Registration” button text” parameter. With this parameter, you can specify the name of the button used to complete registration in the System.
When registering independently, according to the
registration method
provided, the new user must enter an e-mail/phone number and his new password twice in the appropriate fields and click on the “Sign up” button.
The password should meet at least three of the four conditions listed below:
The password must contain at least 8 characters.
The password must contain at least 1 uppercase character.
The password must contain at least 1 lowercase character.
The password must contain at least 8 characters.
The password must match the input mask specified in the settings of the current
security policy
.
To register by SMS, confirm your consent to the
processing of personal data
.
If there is a field to select a
profile
, the user can replace the default value with a profile available in the list.
When registering by SMS, a registration code will be sent to the specified phone number, which must be entered in the appropriate field of the page that opens, and then click on the confirmation button.
A repeated request for confirmation code is available following the
"Number of attempts" and "Time to retry, sec"
parameters.
When registering by e-mail, an e-mail will be sent to the specified e-mail address containing a link to confirm your registration. To complete registration, follow the link.
After successful registration, the app
start page
will open.
For the further authorization in the application, use the phone number/e-mail specified during registration. It can be changed in the User profile (see
here
).
After registering a user in the application, an instance of the “Employee” type is created (or a type inherited from it and specified when
setting up the profile
in the “Employee Reference” field). Where:
when registering by e-mail, the email address entered by the user during registration will be saved in the "E-MAIL" [EMAIL] attribute;
when registering by SMS, the telephone number entered by the user is stored in the “Phone” attribute [PHONE];
the value of the "Employee Unit" attribute [EMP_ORG_ID] is set to the value of the "Employee Unit" profile parameter.
A new instance will appear in the
User
object type [SYS_USER], where:
the "Employee" attribute (EMP_ID) will be set to the value created in the "Employee Reference" type of the employee;
the password entered during registration is recorded in the corresponding attributes of the user-defined and string-type password (PWD, CHANGE_PWD).
External identity providers
Displays OAuth 2.0 application login, which is accomplished by moving the SSO Login switch to the active position.
To authorize in the application using OAuth 2.0 protocol it is necessary to make settings in the configuration file of the application, more details can be found in the
instructions
.
After activating the switch, the “Setting text” field will become available, through which the text of the link displayed in the authorization window is set.
The default value is “Login via SSO”.
Password change
The section provides options for configuring the password change page and contains two subsections:
Title
In addition to the set of parameters discussed earlier, this subsection contains the "Header text when changing the password" parameter. This parameter is used to set the name of the header on the password change page.
Button
In this section, the display of the button on the password change page is configured.
In addition to the set of parameters discussed earlier, this subsection contains the parameter "The text of the button when changing the password". Using this parameter, the name of the button used by the user to save changes when updating the password is set.
Password recovery
To grant the user the right to restore the password, it is necessary to switch the "Password recovery is available" switch to the active position in this section.
After that, the following settings will be displayed in the sidebar:
Title
In addition to the set of parameters considered by
previously
, this subsection of the "Password Recovery" section contains the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Header text when entering the e-mail
Entering the header name for the page where the e-mail profile of the user who forgot the password is entered
Header text when confirming the e-mail
Enter the header name on the page to confirm the email address.
Header text when changing the password
Entering the header name for the page for entering a new password to the profile whose e-mail was specified earlier to restore access.
Button
In this section, the display of buttons on password recovery pages is configured.
Setting
Purpose
Header text for the button when entering the e-mail
Enter the name of the button on the e-mail entry page.
Button text when confirming the password
Enter the name of the button on the email address confirmation page.
Button text when changing the password
Enter the name of the button to save the changed password.
Views of the configured password recovery pages are available on the sub-tabs:
"Enter e-mail";
"Confirm e-mail";
"Password change".
Custom Template
In this section, you can upload a zip archive file containing folders with html files. This way, you can customize the login page using html code and go beyond the capabilities provided by the constructor.
In the
SaaS environment
, when using the
Community Edition
license, uploading a custom template is not available.
The restrictions applied to the uploaded file are adjusted using
application configuration file
.
